question: The subspaces of $\mathbb{R}^2$ are:
answer1: The set $\left\{(0, 0)\right\}$, all the lines of  $\mathbb{R}^2$ containing $(0, 0)$ and $\mathbb{R}^2$
answer2: The set $\left\{(0, 0)\right\}$, all the lines of  $\mathbb{R}^2$ and $\mathbb{R}^2$

question: Let $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ be the linear operator given by  $T(x,y,z)=(x-2z,-2x+y+5z,4x+2y-6z)$. Indicate which of the following vectors does not belong to the range of $T$.

$\dfrac{x}{3}= \dfrac{3}{x}$

x & 2 & 2.5 & 4   \\
\hline
y & 0.5 & 0.4 & 0.25 \\
\end{array}$$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & z & - & t & = & 1\\
x & - & 2y & + & 3z & + & t &  = & 1\\
x & - & y & + & 3z & + & t & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\}$.

question: Consider the vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$, $v_1=(2, 0, 1)$, $v_2=(1, -1, 3)$, $v_3=(1, 1, -2)$ and $v_4=(3, 1, 0)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$
answer3: The space generated by $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $v_3$ is a linear combination of $v_2$ and $v_4$

Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$

answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$

question:
Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

question:
What is the determinant of the matrix  $A=\left( 
 \begin{array}{rrrr}
x & 0 &  0 & -x  \\ 
0 & -x & -1 & 1  \\ 
 1 & 0 & x & -1  \\ 
x & 0 &  0 & 1 \end{array}
\right)$, $x\neq 0$?

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 0 \\
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are $\left(\frac{5}{2}y,\,y,\,\frac{3}{2}y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(5,2,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:
What is the determinant of the matrix  $A=\left( 
 \begin{array}{rrrr}
x & 0 &  0 & -x  \\ 
0 & -x & -1 & 1  \\ 
 1 & 0 & x & -1  \\ 
x & 0 &  0 & 1 \end{array}
\right)$, $x\neq 0$?

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x_1 &- &x_2 &- &3x_3 &+ &4x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &x_2 &+ &x_3 &+ &2x_4 &= &-1 \\
& &- &x_2 &- &2x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &2x_2 &+ &3x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &-2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$(x_3-3x_4,-1-2x_3+x_4, x_3, x_4), \, \forall x_3,x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$
answer3:
The system has many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(1-3x_4,-1+x_4, 1, x_4), \, \forall x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$.

question: Consider the linear application $T:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $T(x,y)= \left(2x-y,6x-3y\right)$. Choose the wrong answer.

answer1: S1 and S2 are both true
answer2: S1 is true, S2 is false
answer3: S1 is false, S2 is true
answer4: S1 and S2 are both false

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & z & - & t & = & 1\\
x & - & 2y & + & 3z & + & t &  = & 1\\
x & - & y & + & 3z & + & t & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\}$.

The solution of the problem $\max f(x)$ is equal to:
Mark the true statement.
answer1: The sum of the amplitudes of the external angles of any triangle is always equal to $360^\circ$.
answer2: The sum of the amplitudes of the external angles of a convex quadrilateral is always equal to $540^\circ$.
answer3: The sum of the amplitudes of the external angles of a convex pentagon is always equal to  $720^\circ$.
answer4: The sum of the amplitudes of the external angles of a convex hexagon is always equal to $900^\circ$.

question: Consider the linear transformation $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, such that $F(x, y)=(x+2y, 2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$.
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator.
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$.

question:

$p=q+r$
Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
-x & + & y & + & z & = & a \\
&  & y & + & 3z & = & b \\
x &  &  & + & z & = & c
\end{cases}$$
answer1: For every value of $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(a-b+2c,\,3a-2b+3c,\,-a+b-c\right)$.
answer3:
The system has no solution for $a\neq 0$. 
If $a=0$ and for every value of $b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(2c-b,\,3c-2b,\,b-c\right)$.
answer4: For every value of $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has $\left(1,\,1,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
